headline.main: We Found Oil! Is That Good?

docs.abstract: New ways to extract oil and natural gas could buy the U.S. some time to develop renewable energy. Or they could keep us addicted to dirty fuels.
docs.snippet: New ways to extract oil and natural gas could buy the U.S. some time to develop renewable energy. Or they could keep us addicted to dirty fuels.

docs.lead_paragraph: Barbara DeBuono of Orbis International says new leaders may need six months to a year to get to know their organizations.

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Tuesday

docs.abstract: A look at the news in the English-Language Indian press.
docs.snippet: A look at the news in the English-Language Indian press.

docs.lead_paragraph: The political storm created by the 2G spectrum scam continues to dominate headlines, as a joint parliamentary committee meeting devoted to the issue Monday witnessed a fiery exchange (Hindustan Times). Opposition members accused the government of concealing relevant information and, in particular, of having rewritten a word in the internal note of March 25 from the finance ministry to the prime minister's office. That document appeared to blame the previous finance minister, P Chidambaram, for failing to prevent the scam. According to a two-page letter from the current finance minister, Pranab Mukherjee, to the prime minister, Manmohan Singh, the note was drafted after detailed consultations with the prime minister's office and the cabinet secretariat, and issued at the behest of the prime minister's office. (Times of India).
